document.heading: Extension of the Moratorium on Retail Service Station Conversions Amendment Act of 1988

history.narrative: Law 7-148, the “Extension of the Moratorium on Retail Service Station Conversions Amendment Act of 1988,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 7-316, which was referred to the Committee on Consumer and Regulatory Affairs and reassigned to the Committee on Human Services. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on June 14, 1988 and June 28, 1988, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on June 30, 1988, it was assigned Act. No. 7-200 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review.
